sentences.en: Go right ahead, I'm sure you don't need me to organize you.
sentences.cn: 只管干吧，我相信你用不着我来为你安排。

sentences.en: He began to organize his materials.
He has the ability to organize.
In the end, we all decided to organize a concert for Easter.
sentences.cn: 最终，我们一致决定组织一场复活节音乐会。

sentences.en: It's the first time farmers have decided to organize.
sentences.cn: 这是农场主首次决定组织起来。

sentences.en: She took a hasty cup of coffee and tried to organize her scattered thoughts.
sentences.cn: 她匆匆喝了杯咖啡，试图整理一下纷乱的思绪。

sentences.en: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.cn: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.en: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.cn: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.en: The lawyer helped to organize a group of parents who took action for their children.
sentences.cn: 这位律师帮助把一群为孩子而采取行动的家长组织起来。

sentences.en: They began to organize a mass trespass.
sentences.cn: 他们开始组织大规模的侵犯.

sentences.en: This technique will help people mentally organize information.
sentences.cn: 这项技术将帮助人们在脑子里组织信息。

sentences.en: To write a good essay you must first organize your ideas logically.
sentences.cn: 要写出好文章,必须先从逻辑上理顺思绪.

sentences.en: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.cn: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

sentences.en: We have to get our act together — we have to organize ourselves.
sentences.cn: 我们必须把劲儿往一处使——我们得组织起来。

sentences.en: We need someone with lots of personality to organize the party.
sentences.cn: 我们需要有个人见人爱的人来组织聚会.

sentences.en: We'll organize this business into two separate companies.
sentences.cn: 我们将把这个企业改组成为两个独立的公司.

sentences.en: Who's going to organize the sandwiches for Monday's meeting?
sentences.cn: 谁来准备星期一会议上的叁明治?

sentences.en: Why not organize the facilities in a more goal - directed way?
sentences.cn: 为什么不以更直接的目标导向方式组织 呢 ?

words.tran_cn: 有组织的；组织起来的（等于organized）
有组织的；安排有秩序的；做事有条理的
有机地；有组织地；器官上地
[生物] 器官；机构；风琴；管风琴；嗓音
组织者；承办单位；[生物] 组织导体
组织（等于organize）；有机化；给予生机

trans.tran_cn: 组织，安排，规划，建立组织
trans.tran_en: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

trans.tran_cn: 组织， 安排； 使有条理； 使有机化
trans.tran_en: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively
